result.execSummary:
All charges against Matthew E Jackson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew E Jackson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 17

09:44 AM Defendant appeared with Attorney Brian Delaney.  Attorney Carl Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness Officer M. S. is called and duly sworn.  Direct examination by ADA Lazarus.  Witness identifies DE in court.  Cross examination by Atty Delaney.  State moves for bindover; reserves rebuttal.  Atty Deleney objects to bindover with argument.  Rebuttal by ADA Lazarus.  Court finds probable cause for bindover to Br 17.
and returned.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process no later than 2/25/2022. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with HPK. 
- Defendant shall not be in the Village of Mcfarland.
- The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS). The defendant shall report by ___ at ___ AM/PM. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to pretrial services (already on pretrial services for 21CF2618)

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court with an Attorney from Attorney Tracey A. Woods office.  John D Rice appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Julie Beyler from DCPS is in court. In court today for multiple DCPS violations. State gives argument. Ms. Beyler makes statement. Atty Delaney gives argument. Court makes findings and will not modify any conditions to this case. As to the new case of 22CF431, the court will add pretrial services for GPS monitoring to this case prior to going through the preliminary hearing. All other bail conditions will remain the same.
